Review: This game is the best coop game I've ever played in my entire 40 couple years on this planet. I played this with my wife, who is not a gamer. Not only did this turn her into a gamer, it showed her just how amazing video games can be. Play this game with your significant other, even if they don't like games. They will after finishing this. This is about all i can muster into actual words, if you have played it, you know, if you haven't, please do yourself a favor and play it.

This game made me realize how much I love my wife because she is absolutely trash at it, and my patience is taking heavy hits on the playthrough. I guess it's supposed to be that way, and if you play this with your beloved non-gamer other half don't say I didn't warn you!

it's a MUST play!

Cute and well made story.
Amazing world design.
Great gameplay.

Stop reading this review, just buy it and enjoy it! 
It's 95% positive, and it's published by EA! 
It's like seeing a unicorn!

I saw so many videos of this game and thought it looked really fun but I did not realise what I was in for. This is the most innovative game I have played to date. Some games are good, some are great but this one is just so special. The levels are so creative and blew all my expectations out of the water. Just when I thought the game was coming to an end, we were taken to another phenomenal level. The movement and controls are so fun, it feels so smooth. The puzzles felt very clever and I loved working through them with my partner. It was also really fun that both characters had a role in each level, they really focused on showing that one was not better than the other; nor could one continue without the other. The story was funny and emotional at the same time, with small parts of ... darkness. I really feel at a loss for words to describe how remarkable this game is.
I could not recommend it enough!!

It Takes Two is game for - you guessed it- two. Overall experience was really nice, feeling high quality, variety of gameplay - in every chapter there is different mechanic also tons of minigames. Playing this with my partner I did have amazing, enjoyable time. HOWEVER, I didn't like the story as much as I would like to. For example - Elephant. Kill*ng with no remorse after mutil*ating her so they could make their daughter cry? Pretty traumatic scene... But I just hated the fact that they had no thoughts after. No self reflection that what they did was bad? Unnecessary? No one said they are supposed to do that. They decided that it's way to go, it gave nothing and they had no self reflection - "oh no! we made our stressed, sad daughter cry as if her world wasn't already getting destroyed by our divorce. We are awful". They should be dying with guilt of making their daughter suffer for no reason at all, unable to repair their mistake because of their situation.
No foreshadowing of May singing hobby, which was totally out of nowhere, also this chapter gameplay-wise was also the weakest. 
I feel like the creators had awesome idea, it started really well, but went downhill in the end. In the begining scene we see that May is working her ass off so they could have best life possible, she comes back from work and asks Cody if he took daughter to the dentist. We see that even if he is stay at home dad, May STILL has to take care of most basic sh*t. And plot twist - in the end it doesn't even change. I did enjoy them getting their spark back however my partner was first like "damn, I'd hate to be with Cody". Also gameplay-wise May gets more difficult stuff to do, for example garden chapter - May was supposed to support Cody's hobby of gardening. So gameplay-wise Cody was support for May's offensive XD I saw opinion that it's showing how women have to do most of the stuff and no one even notices, but I doubt that's the case. Because if it was why didn't we get gradually shifting the balance to be equal? Game was supposed to show me two people changing.

Overall - I do recommend this game as a split screen co-op game. Graphics feels high quality, variety of gameplay was a great way to go. It takes two is really enjoyable to play. However I do feel that it was rushed a little bit. As I said, idea was great, start was great, but it went downhill. Last two chapters felt much shorter and rushed - both gameplay-wise and plot-wise.

This is a good co-op game but there's a lot wrong with it that I just...I wouldn't recommend it or play it again. Maybe because I have a successful marriage that I just don't get it?? But like...man. The writing doesn't feel complete. We're constantly finding out new and random things about the couple as the game goes on that doesn't feel consistent. It also doesn't seem like they ever talked...ever. Like, May not having time to work with her hands but then we find out her hobby is singing in the last chapter? And that's cool and all, multifaceted characters, but it felt more like there were multiple writers not talking to each other. There's a part right at the beginning of the garden scene where they are kindly talking to each other and then it comes out of the cutscene and they immediately rag on each other again..but for the same topic they were just agreeing and complimenting each other about? Also, it flips play styles a lot which helps it keep fresh feeling but nothing ever felt like it lasted long enough. It would be like "oh, cool, what a neat idea" and then it would be over super quickly. Also there's one part where there's circles around the characters highlighting them in one singular small part where the screen is shared. and NEVER AGAIN... but there are SO MANY other puzzles, especially the clock scenes and garden scenes, where this could have benefitted because it was so hard to see the characters compared to the settings. Also, Rose just does NOT come off like an actual child. At all. She just seems like an adult pretending to be a child. Including the voice. And like...how long did they just leave Rose alone. Also, the whole game feels like a solid collaboration on the levels between players but then...you get to the final section with the music scenes and it felt like we were just waiting for one player to do what they needed to do so you could just move forward. In my opinion, the snow village and the castle sections were amazing. May and Cody felt like actual people during these sections. However, it did make me laugh that the way they were talking was making it seem like everything was hunky dory and then Rose came along. Who, I'm not dissing her at all, Rose is cool as hell as a kid. But they turn and it immediately turns into a Rose is the problem section. But also, I was fully convinced that Dr. Hakim was going to be the antagonist the whole time. I was looking forward to a boss battle where we just tore him apart. He was incredibly annoying and rude. Plus, he felt like a stereotype on top of that. The whole music section? May is legitimately uncomfortable. She didn't need pushing. Both Hakim and Cody are pushing her like WAY too much. It's really problematic. We'd have great moments and then he'd just pop up. This whole game would have been so much better if Dr. Hakim didn't exist. Also, nothing is really solved in this. At all between them. They still need to divorce. They don't talk, they didn't fix anything, it takes two but not these two.

One of the best co-op story games I've ever played. It's so much fun to play with a friend.
Awsome Story , Amazing Gameplay , Amazing Graphic. 10/10

[h1] A Visually Stunning and Ever-Changing Fantasy World  [/h1]

The game's visuals are truly stunning. While human characters may seem a bit stiff in their animations, the fact that the protagonists are dolls makes this a non-issue. The world design is especially impressive, transforming an ordinary home and garden into a massive playground full of magical elements.

From navigating giant furniture and electrical wires to exploring a toy wonderland, a snowy crystal ball world, intricate clockwork mechanisms, and a lush garden teeming with insects, the game offers a wide variety of beautifully crafted environments. These diverse settings keep the game fresh and prevent players from feeling stuck in the same location for too long.

Each level is filled with interactive objects and hidden easter eggs, enhancing the sense of exploration. There are also mini-games where players can compete against each other, adding more fun beyond the main adventure.

[h1] Brilliant Co-Op Gameplay Design[/h1]

It Takes Two is built entirely around cooperative play, and its level design reflects this perfectly. The screen is split in half, allowing both players to see their character and their partner's movements. The smooth camera transitions occasionally switch to a full-screen perspective, providing a cinematic view of the world.

Seeing both characters on the screen at all times makes it easier for players to coordinate their actions. The gameplay mechanics are also well-designed—both characters can jump, double-jump, wall-jump, dash, and ground-pound. In addition, each player receives unique tools throughout the levels, requiring them to work together to solve puzzles and progress.

For example, in an early level, May uses a hammer to break objects while Cody wields a nail gun to create platforms. Their abilities complement each other, emphasizing teamwork. Each stage introduces new mechanics, ranging from platforming and shooting to puzzle-solving, RPG-style battles, action sequences, and boss fights.

The game spans about 10–15 hours, and every moment feels fresh—there are no repetitive maps, tedious collectible hunts, or filler content. Instead, players encounter a constant stream of engaging mini-games and surprises, making the experience exciting from start to finish.

The game is also very accessible. The controls are simple and easy to learn, and the difficulty is forgiving. If one player dies, they can respawn as long as their partner is still alive. Even if both players fail, the game quickly resets at a nearby checkpoint, minimizing frustration. This makes it a great game for players of all skill levels, including those who are new to action games.

[h1] Memorable Characters, but a Simple Story [/h1]

The story follows Cody and May, a couple on the verge of divorce who are transformed into dolls. Guided by the eccentric and comedic Book of Love, Dr. Hakim, they must work together to return to their human forms.

The main cast consists of only four characters: the logical and work-focused May, the home-oriented and plant-loving Cody, their kind-hearted daughter Rose, and the over-the-top Dr. Hakim. Each character has a distinct personality, with Hakim standing out as the most entertaining. His exaggerated mannerisms and humorous antics add charm to the story.

The game cleverly integrates the couple’s struggles into the level design. For instance, a stage about their lost connection features magnet-based puzzles, while Cody’s neglected garden and May’s abandoned passion for singing become central themes in other levels.

However, the overall plot is quite straightforward, lacking major twists or deep emotional moments. While the game touches on love, family, and personal growth, it doesn’t explore these themes in great depth. That said, since the focus is on gameplay rather than storytelling, the simple narrative isn’t a major downside.

It such an amazing game to play with your couple (in my case, i played with my wife). But some bosses are to hard to fight because my wife doesn't get used to play little bit tense of game. 
She got nervous easily.

It Takes Two – Early Impressions

After playing through the first couple of bosses in It Takes Two, I can already see why this game has been praised so highly. It’s an incredibly engaging and well-crafted co-op experience that truly demands teamwork, patience, and creative problem-solving.

Every challenge so far has felt unique, with mechanics that push both players to work together seamlessly. The boss fights are tough but rewarding, requiring coordination and quick thinking to succeed. The level design is imaginative, keeping the gameplay fresh and exciting.

What I love most is how It Takes Two doesn’t just rely on platforming skills—it encourages communication, making it a perfect game for players who enjoy strategizing and adapting to new mechanics. The puzzles, action sequences, and humor all blend together into a fun and immersive experience.

So far, it’s been both challenging and fun, and I can’t wait to see what’s next! I almost forgot to mention that it’s fully compatible with Steam Deck too.
Great game with tons of variety in levels and mechanics

I played A Way Out before I played It Takes Two and I knew I wanted to play this game upon hearing it would be released.  A 2 player split-screen online co-op game is somewhat rare and I've been looking for games exactly like this.

While A Way Out was a good game, it had it issues and in some ways was a bit clunky. It Takes Two improved on all the issues it's predecessor had in every single way.  It's a great game to introduce people who normally don't game to a genre, fun settings, minigames and story. It's a experience to be enjoyed by all.
Beautiful game, great visuals, good story. A truly engaging experience.

The story is quite simple and linear, but I gives 4 thumbs (cuz that's all i have ehm) for the gameplay. It incorporate various mechanism in every stages, making the game less monotonous. I highly recommend this games, friendly for even non-gamers partners.
great game to bond and spend time with your partner or friends. storyline and graphics really cool too. looking forward to more similar games!

My husband and I binge played this across two days and it was 100% worth it. It Takes Two is an absolutely gorgeous game and one of the most enjoyable co-op experiences I have experienced to date.  The environments are meticulously detailed (right down to the fingerprint marks on Cody's clay face) and encourage interaction/exploration even outside of the cooperative aspect. The amount of variety this game has packed into it really does accommodate for all kinds of gamers out there. My only complaint is that sometimes the camera movements would get a bit wonky at critical moments, but thankfully the game is very forgiving if you die. 

Do not pass up this title. I managed to snag it while on sale, but it really is worth the full price tag, too.

Great story, sweet ending. Idk why we didn't play it earlier. This game is a masterpiece with many references to other games (and even movies like Terminator 2 LOL) and is worth all that money and more. Now we plan to play “A Way Out”, “Split Fiction” and other games from this wonderful developer. ∞/10

A great time playing with my lovely long distance partner, one of those games that you can actually enjoy without too much hassle without too much lag and input delay. The physics are so responsive and allows for a very fluid gaming experience. Also, props to the creative game, incredible amount of effort into thinking about every level and the details in each level! If you are in a relationship, or have a really close friend to play with, this is a must!

Legitimately one of my favorite games in recent memory. The value for dollar here is almost off the charts especially factoring in the friend pass. Fair warning, this game will make you feel things. Graphics are fantastic, game play is fun and simple enough for anyone to pick up and play, story is amazing. Honest 10/10.

Very nice game, me and my gf enjoyed it from start to finish. It really requires a lot of cooperation xD
The core gameplay is a puzzle platformer with a ton of minigames, but sometimes it switches to top-down shooter, 3-D action, fighting (!) etc.
I think developers purposely gave most active and damaging abilities to May (which is usually a gf-side) so most gamer-bfs would not be able to solo the game for both people.

+ nice graphics (a bit cartoonish for my style, but nice)
+ good gameplay that is various, interesting and engaging
+ minigames (can cause some conflicts tho if both people are competitive, just try to not destroy your partner's ego xD)
+ a lot of easter eggs and references


- unskippable cutscenes
- possible trusting issues afterwards :smile:

All in all i would totally recommend this game if you have a special person (with gaming experience, because playing May with gamepad could be a bit challenging) but was a LOT OF FUN

It Takes Two is what happens when a rom-com and a fever dream collide in a co-op game. You play as Cody and May, a couple on the verge of divorce, who are magically turned into tiny dolls by their daughter’s tears. (Yes, tears. Apparently, children are full of black magic.) From there, you’re forced to work together through a series of ridiculous, mind-bending levels while being coached—if you can call it that—by Dr. Hakim, a sentient self-help book who might as well be the lovechild of Tony Robbins and a mariachi band.

The gameplay is pure chaos in the best way. Every level introduces new mechanics, like flying on fidgety tools, wielding a hammerhead like Thor’s broke cousin, or straight-up engaging in a snowball fight to the death. One moment, you’re in a whimsical garden; the next, you’re fighting a squirrel who thinks it’s Batman. It’s not just a game; it’s an elaborate excuse to sabotage your partner and then say, “No, it was definitely your fault.”

The story is surprisingly heartfelt, which is impressive considering it involves psychotic vacuums and homicidal bees. It sneaks in moments of genuine reflection about relationships between all the absurdity, just to keep you emotionally off-balance. You’ll laugh, you’ll cry, and you’ll probably shout, “WHY CAN’T YOU JUST PULL THE LEVER?!”

Final Verdict: 10/10. Play this with someone you love, but maybe not someone you’d trust to defuse a bomb. It’s an unforgettable blend of hilarity, teamwork, and mild emotional trauma.
It's a fun game. It'll test your trust for your friends for sure (lol), but honestly, I can't recommend it enough.

Crazy that I can play this game that was on sale for $7 canadian and have a way more adventurous, exciting and emotional ride for 10 hours. When I get less out of BIGGER names that cost easily $90+ 

The design of this game was amazing everything seemed to have a good purpose or look that made complete sense.

⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐ (5/5)

It Takes Two is a breathtaking co-op adventure that masterfully blends innovative gameplay with heartfelt storytelling. Developed by Hazelight Studios, this game isn’t just another platformer—it’s a deeply immersive journey that requires true teamwork to succeed.

🎮 Gameplay: A Constantly Evolving Experience
From the moment you start playing, It Takes Two keeps you on your toes with ever-changing mechanics. Unlike other games that rely on repetitive actions, every level introduces fresh, creative gameplay elements. Whether you're navigating gravity-defying puzzles, riding on the backs of giant frogs, or engaging in epic boss battles, the game never gets dull.

❤️ Story: A Heartfelt Tale of Love and Redemption
At its core, It Takes Two tells the touching story of Cody and May, a married couple on the brink of divorce who are magically transformed into tiny doll versions of themselves. Guided by the eccentric Dr. Hakim, they must work together to find their way back to their daughter—and to each other. The emotional depth of the narrative is beautifully woven into the gameplay, making for a truly moving experience.

🎨 Visuals & Sound: A Stunning, Vibrant World
The game’s visuals are nothing short of spectacular. Each environment bursts with creativity, from lush gardens to whimsical toy castles. Paired with a charming soundtrack and fantastic voice acting, the game creates a magical world that feels alive at every turn.

🤝 Co-Op at Its Best
Unlike many games that simply allow for cooperative play, It Takes Two requires two players, making teamwork an essential part of the experience. The puzzles, platforming, and action sequences demand communication and coordination, making it one of the best co-op games ever created.

✨ Final Verdict: A Must-Play for Any Duo
Whether you're playing with a partner, a friend, or a family member, It Takes Two is an unforgettable adventure that perfectly balances fun, challenge, and storytelling. With its brilliant design and emotionally rich narrative, it’s a game that will stay with you long after the credits roll.

Final Score: 10/10 🎮🔥

The controls are easy, and the level design is fun and beautiful. The explanations of tasks and controls are straightforward. Mini-games add a nice pause from the story, but that is not to say the main story is lacking.

Great visuals, great story, great user experience. Overall I had a great time playing this game with my Girlfriend, it even made her cry at the end. :) I strongly recommend this to everyone to try it out.

I can highly recommend It Takes Two. I found the game play, graphics, story and voice acting to be of middling quality. It is a Frankenstein's monster of gaming genres. To list a few it has platformer, puzzler, adventure, shooter, hack and slash, rhythm, and racer elements. There are some beautiful moments, but the thing that makes It Takes Two shine is in the title. This game is lovingly crafted for two player cooperation. It is very friendly to novices. My wife is not a video gamer, but we completed It Takes Two together. In spite of every challenge, we loved it.

An excellent co-op adventure with plenty of heart and soul in both its story and gameplay. The light puzzle-solving elements keep things engaging, and the co-op mechanics are well-designed. Played this with my brother, and we had an absolute blast! Surprisingly, we didn’t get in each other’s way much, which made for a smooth and enjoyable experience.

[h1]完美的电子童话[/h1]

能感觉到制作组在开发的许多方面都有所克制，在自己能掌控的范围内呈现出了相当理想的作品。

剧情背景是合家欢式的爱情+家庭主题，各种播片演出时长都恰到好处，一两分钟完成剧情推进和情绪渲染。

通过线性的游戏流程加上扎实的技术力，玩家能充分沉浸到作品塑造的梦境中。
游玩的时候通过抽象操作其实也测出过两三次需要读存档点的bug，但是整体的探索体验和操作手感还是很舒适。

作品从大关卡到小游戏都充斥着天马行空的想象力，堪称皮克斯的场景演出加任天堂的游戏设计。

需要两名玩家可能是这游戏唯一的缺点。
[spoiler]虽然没有妹妹，但是两次跟兄弟一起打的体验其实都很不错[/spoiler]

It Takes Two is an absolute joy to play, especially with my wife! The game’s creative co-op mechanics, heartwarming story, and constant variety kept us engaged and entertained the whole time. Every level introduces something new and exciting, making teamwork both fun and rewarding. It's easily one of the best co-op experiences we've had—highly recommend it for couples looking for a great time together! 🎮

I like this game because you play as a husband or wife who is considering divorce. The missions are awesome, and you have to work together, which makes the storyline even more engaging. To play the game, you need to download another app and have a friend join you. Overall, it's a great cooperative experience! 😊

It Takes Two is an absolutely incredible game! This is my first time leaving a comment on a game, but I just had to say how impressed I am. The creativity, level design, and unique mechanics are on another level. Every part of the game feels fresh and fun. I’ve never played anything like it before. The co-op experience is just perfect. This is a terrible game. Looks cute, puzzles are kinda fun though scripted, but the story is horrible. Do not let the graphics fool you - this is NOT worth spending money on.
The main characters are divorcing each other and the whole story is how their daughter is miserable because of her parents. They do nothing that shows they care about her - only themselves. The 'puzzle games' are all about how they learn to work together to make their poor child even more miserable and destroy her favorite things. 
We stopped playing when they started heading to rip their daughter's favorite toy apart. Reviews show that there is no way to stop this from happening and they learn nothing. I'm not going to finish this game. The main characters are ripping into each other the entire time, which was honestly not enjoyable when playing with my partner. It's not fun ribbing, it's just mean. The two main characters are mean to each other, mean to their daughter, mean to everyone they encounter. What is the lesson here? You can have fun while making torturing everyone around you and making them miserable? 0/10, would refund if I could. The stupid elephant scene is way past the refund point. Poor Rose needs different parents. 
Get a different puzzle game - do NOT waste your money on this trash. It is not even worth the sale price - do NOT spend $40 on this pile of shit.

[h3] 10/10 Because [b] CO-LLA-BO-RATION! [/b] is everything! [/h3]

This game is the purest form of friendship, communication, and teamwork! It Takes Two isn’t a game you can play alone, and honestly, you wouldn’t want to. The real magic comes from experiencing this adventure with someone else. If that person happens to be patient, supportive, and has a great sense of humor, this game becomes something truly special.

Cody and May’s journey is about much more than just fixing a marriage. Every puzzle, every obstacle in this game requires [b] CO-LLA-BO-RATION! [/b] You constantly learn new mechanics, and the game never feels repetitive. One moment you’re playing with gravity, the next you’re having a duel with a giant squirrel. Every chapter tests a different aspect of working together.

I played as May in It Takes Two… and honestly, I wasn’t very good. I kept dying, missing jumps, and struggling with even the simplest platforming sections. But the person playing with me was always patient, never rushed me, and did everything possible to help. Sometimes, just to make me laugh, they’d do silly moves in-game to lighten the mood. And that’s why It Takes Two isn’t just a game—it’s a story about friendship and achieving something together.

The graphics are incredibly vibrant and creative. Each level feels like an entirely new experience, with unique themes and mechanics. In every chapter, there were times when we just stopped to admire the graphics. They were all crafted with incredible precision—it was impossible not to be amazed. The story has depth, the characters grow over time, and the dialogue is genuinely funny and engaging. 

In the end, It Takes Two is more than a game—it’s an experience filled with shared memories. If you’re thinking of playing it, make sure you have someone patient and fun-loving by your side. Because this journey simply can’t be completed alone. 

P.S.: I played as May and kept falling, but at least someone was always there waiting for me. Thanks mate! :)
Experience of playing this game is simply remarkable and one of a kind.

好玩，游戏里面很多场景和互动方式都让人眼前一亮，非常推荐
Weirder and more messed up than expected, thought it would be a children's game but ended up enjoying it far more than i could've ever imagined.
Amazingly Immersive game with outstanding visuals and breath taking scenes/views. Though this is considered a couples game in some people's eyes, it can still be played fine with a friend!
Absolutely loved this game! Played it with my wife and even though she was kinda clumsy that made it even more fun (and even more frustrating at places). :D 10/10.

it was fun when playing with friends........

until you reach the ending and it can be awkward......... >/////<
One of my favorite games I've ever played! Definitely replaying it over and over and over again.

Incredible game overall. My girlfriend and I we had a amazing time finishing this game together. It's fun, challenging, beautiful and wholesome. The phases kept surprising us with a insane diversity of environments that would bring new mechanics and different bosses at the end of every level, most being quite challenging. 
We only had a problem with the sound in which the voices during cutscenes would just not work, that was sad, but the subtitles saved the game, and was just only towards the end. Overall beautiful game.
The game was an absolute blast! I like the storyline and the minigames, and we loved how the game constantly kept things fresh. Highly recommend!

its cute, not too difficult to figure out, def a good game for couples. if i'm being honest though. i wish the very last part was a choice driven option. either have rose cry or have them kiss and make up. one ending is they still get divorced another is they stay together. because even through trials and tribulations couples sometimes do better separate then together. thats just me though liking multi choice games and looking at a reality aspect of it. but how the game is i overall recommend it for its story, long game play hours and atmosphere

The best coop game I have played so far. Lovely scenarios, great gameplay, interesting mechanics and every time you think you had all you ever needed, BAM! you get two levels more with cool things! An absolute MUST
S tier game especially for introducing non gamers to diffrent mechanics.

It takes two, and its fun!

Game is much longer than expected, and has fun mini games to unlock/find
Really good, fun, creative couch co-op.
Really nice game for playing with your partner!!! Not finished yet but enjoying the time spent together. 9/10
I highly recommend this game, it's a beautiful experience. I enjoyed every second playing it, can't wait for Split Fiction to come out :)
Game is good but it has a bug where the other player can't join when playing online when i searched for solution online a lot of people are facing the same issue  EA fix please
The best couch co-op I've played in many years. Great gameplay, story and beautiful environments. Puzzles and boss fights are amazingly designed. Really recommended!
Absolutely brilliant, this is a masterpiece, grab a friend and play it 10/10

I highly recommend It Takes Two!
The gameplay is fun and creative, with levels that need teamwork. 
The world is beautiful and the characters have great chemistry. 
The story is heartwarming and funny. 
It’s a co-op game with unique twists, making It Takes Two definitely worth playing!

⭐ 11/10 – A masterpiece of Coop Gaming ⭐

played It Takes Two with my girlfriend, and we were absolutely blown away. This game is a beautiful, heartfelt, and insanely creative journey that kept us hooked from start to finish. Every level introduces fresh mechanics, the storytelling is emotional yet fun, and the co-op gameplay is  unmatched.

We spen more than 16 hours on it, though Steam only registered 11 because I wasn’t connected to the internet—but every single second was worth it. It’s rare to find a game that truly requires teamwork in such a meaningful way, and this game  nailssss it. If you have someone to play with, buy it without hesitation.

Worth every cent.

My absolute favorite coop game! A totally unique and memorable experience to play with someone. The colorful world, the cinematic storytelling, the various game mechanics and the asymmetric and cooperative gameplay are all top notch, and make this the best coop I have ever played. Don't hesitate, go ahead and play this!

This is my number 1 game in my personal opinion and i've played really good games. It is by far the most creative and exciting gaming experience all packed into a fun and life lesson filled game. I would recommend this to anybody and everybody who plays videos games.

It Takes Two is a great Co-Op game with its visuals, many different levels and different game play. It's perfect for casual gamers and experienced alike. I've laughed over May and Cody's dynamic and even felt sympathy for their journey. My favorite is the repayable mini-games you can discover. You definitely need time and patience for a complete play-through and all achievements found but its extremely fun to play with a partner or your best friend. The cut-scenes are un-skippable but I love all the characters

Wife and I got it on sale and started playing it. It was a really fun 2 player game! We absolutely loved the boss fights and pretty much everything about this game! Planning on playing again as the other player so we can experience both sides. :)

This was an absolutely perfect co-op experience. My wife and I loved every moment of playing it together. The story was cute and well-made, the world design was amazing, and the gameplay was super fun from start to finish. Easily the best co-op game I’ve played so far, and it’s clear why it was selected as game of the year.

This game is a 10/10. Recommend for anybody who has a friend to play with. It feels a bit long, but honestly with all the new mechanics on each level, it doesn't get boring. Graphics are amazing, game isn't buggy, soundtrack is awesome, puzzles aren't so easy they are boring, but not too hard that they aren't fun, just right. Boss battles are hard enough to be fun as well. I would say this game is "just right" in pretty much all aspects, would (and will likely) play again.
Simply an amazing experience. Probably the most fun 2 player co-op experience you could possibly have !!!
great game to play even if one person knows nothing about video games. story is super creative and fun to follow
Absolutely incredible game, super fun with friends or a significant other.  Graphics, games, and story line is a blast.
A perfect game, great story, great artwork, great music, great gameplay with very high quality in every aspect.

It Takes Two is a masterpiece that transcends gaming—it’s a love letter to collaboration, both in mechanics and emotions. The journey of Cody and May isn’t just about saving their marriage; it’s a poignant metaphor for how love requires constant effort and understanding. Every level is a burst of creativity, from explosive tree sap duets to gravity-defying spacewalks, ensuring you’re never bored. The split-screen design isn’t just functional; it’s poetic, reminding you that true connection means seeing the world through another’s eyes. This game doesn’t just entertain—it heals, challenges, and ultimately unites. A must-play for anyone who believes in the power of ‘we’ over ‘me’.

Getting in sync might take a moment, and one player might need a little extra patience, but the payoff is huge. This game is a beautiful, entertaining, and forgiving experience that strengthens teamwork and creates fun shared memories.
While the story didn't blow me away, the rest of it was incredibly well executed, creative and polished. Looking forward to pick up their next coop title!
This game was indeed one of the best things i've ever played. Made me have a warmer heart leaving the game than going into the game.
Game felt rushed towards the end and the elephant deserved more attention, and care than the plant in the garden.

Great co-op game to play with the people you love. I've only made it to the 4th world so far and the game keeps surprising me with interesting mechanics and unique co-op puzzles to solve. Highly recommend.
to get the full experience, you should divorce your wife. 10/10 rage. filing for divorce in the morning.
fun for adult couples or kids to play together

Bought the game to play with my girlfriend, she loves it, says it's a cute story with fun minigames, great graphics, with an easy to follow story line. Not a terribly long game, short enough to keep from getting repetitive, but long enough that it kept us entertained for a couple days. Overall, I'd say this is a great game to play with a significant other... Fair warning, beware the elephant.

very very good love the game,we* very beautiful not to hard just perfect
9/10 !

P.S DO NOT PLAY MINI GAMES WITH YOUR PARTNER.....
Good fun, story is a bit cringey but the mechanics are interesting and challenging. Be ready to yell at each other :) Love the easy multiplayer. Well thought out!

played this with my best friend, and after spending 20 minutes fighting over who gets to be the girl, we LOVED this game. STILL LOVING IT, it's incredible how many hours of beautiful, detailed, non-repetitive gameplay you can suck out of this game. sososososo worth the money to play with someone you want to go into magical couples therapy led by a wad of latin paper with.

Very sweet game, story driven with beautiful graphics and very chill puzzles. Great game for couples and is very forgiving for those who may not play platformers as often, making it very approachable for all

Probably the most beautiful game i have ever played. The ammount of content you get is worth every single penny. The story telling is very well done. It is incredibly fun to play it with your loved ones and reconnect with them in a digital way. 10/10 will play the next part with my pookie

Great game with very good graphics and gameplay 
You have to work together
Gets better as you progress, very fun to play with your lover. Good mix of cooperative challenges ranging from puzzles to action and some competitive minigames along the way too.
not enough microtransactions, could use a miku collab. pvp was mid, lots of hackers. the book needs a nerf. Not enough diversity tbh, too much woke propaganda.

A game with a really nice vibe with multiple mini-games and challenges that can be hard enough to be entertaining for the seasoned gamer while still manageable for the novice player. Although there are some core mechanics of traversing the different maps some come with additional tools which keeps the game fresh all the way towards the finish-line.

While the game at some points can be "hard" dying is not made punishing which makes it the perfect trial of fire for your relationship.

you sould play this game with your partner, its so much fun and both of you will enjoy it alot.
we finished the game in 11 hours, with 0 arguments, 0 Fights

Fantastic game to play with my girlfriend.

We really have a good time.

Hope there can be more interaction between character's special power.

Because I really had fun at pining my girlfriend's character with those nails.

If you’ve ever wanted to test the limits of your friendship (or relationship) in the most chaotic yet hilarious way possible, this is the game for you! This co op masterpiece throws you and a partner into a wild ride filled with talking books, bickering dolls, and more creative gameplay mechanics than you can count. One moment you’re swinging across chasms using a grappling hook, and the next, you're fending off an army of angry squirrels in an all out war... yes, that actually happens.

THe game shines when played with a good friend who won’t rage quit when you accidentally let them fall to their doom which... happens A LOT. Every level is a uniqu and fresh surprise, keeping things exciting from start to finish. Whether you’re solving puzzles, platforming through wacky environments, or competing in mini-games, there’s never a dull moment. So grab a buddy, embrace the chaos, and prepare to laugh, yell, and maybe even shed a tear. It Takes Two isn’t just a game it’s an adventure, a comedy, and a trust exercise all rolled into one.
really fun game. seriously worth the purchase. planning to play through it a second time already as the other character

Really like the share game option, besides, really cool game, many themes, very cooperative.

9/10

Un jeu de collab vraiment ludique et intéressant ! Pourtant pas fan du genre, nous avons pris du plaisir à chaque moment. 11h de jeu , c'est plus que respectable aujourd'hui pour un jeu. bravo aux créateurs

awesome game that you can play with anyone in your friendslist without them having to purchase it. The game is a match of several gametypes and is good for both children and adults, its fun all the way. Its impossible to avoid falling in love with the game and all the small funny details and minigames while experiencing the adventures of May and Cody.
This is easily the most creative and fun cooperative game I have ever played, well done! Seriously, just play it. Can't wait to play it again using the other character.
very positive energy and fantastic chapters and story, it feels like i have entered inside the game while playing.
Absolute BANGER of a game! I recommend it to EVERYONE. Worth the money y'all. It's emotional, it makes you laugh, you feel every emotion while playing.
playing with my roommate is super fun, we have been enjoying the cute dynamic. Although, why does this nine year old girl need her dad to clean under her bed?
good game but I don't recommend it to ppl w/ bad pc's or laptops, it WILL crash more than once. but overall solid game.
Played this game ngl its worth every penny.It was so much fun to play this game with girlfriend.

It is simply a great Co-op story game. As you advance through the story you will end up playing a variety of different types of games and mini games that you are able to revisit. 

On top of the cool easter eggs they have put into the levels, it is a cool and clever game that is worth checking out. 

I think the only con is which friend should spend the money on the game since there is a free friend pass!

Such an enjoyable co-op game! 
I really like how the gameplay keeps changing, you get many different tools you have to use to progress and some of them are so creative and fun to play with. The characters you control and meet along the way are fun and interesting, and the story takes you to many unexpected places. There is also a wide variety of mini games you can find around the game. The puzzles and bosses are not too challenging, but enough to keep you entertained.
It was longer than I expected, which was a pleasant surprise, but it's well segmented so it didn't feel like I was leaving in the middle of something when I didn't have more time to play.
The story itself is nice, but I'd say that the creative gameplay is what really makes this game shine.
I recommend trying it!
i would highly encourage everyone to try this game with your friend or loved one, it was so much fun and we loved every moment of this gem.

I bought this game for me and my friend since we've been doing a lot of co-op puzzle games recently.
Let's just say that this game is ONE OF THE BEST games I have ever played.

Not only did it give us fun puzzles but also an amazing story with it! We were both so into the entire story and that usually never happens.

Best purchase I've ever made.
Congrats to every person who helped building this game.
Very fun to play and very interesting puzzles that keep you engaged, but I still want my fire sword back :(
This game is not one of the best co-op games. It is the best co-op game for couples.

One of the best games I've ever played. Amazingly written, fun level design, and overall incredible story.
I laughed a bit, cried a lot, and fell in love with this game

Don't let your girlfriend win. It's the only way to make her stronger. Be patient with her, though. Great game with a lot of variety in terms of gameplay. The female character gets to do a lot of the fun stuff.
good graphics good story cant complain

I have been a gamer for around 25 years. This game done what many failed to do in recent years. It kept me entertained from the start right to the end. I can't imagine the amount of ideas developers had, and with most of them they probably said ''why not?''. The final result is outstanding. There is huge amount of variety, you do something else in every chapter + you have mini games hidden all over, the tasks can be challenging but not so much to leave you frustrated. Beautiful story, nice graphics and cool sounds, but gameplay is just out of this planet. I finished the game with my wife and it was worth every penny. The best co-op game I have ever played. Thank you Hazelight Studios for this amazing experience!

One of the coolest co-op game ever maded!
Design,graphic page,enemy,weapons,minigames,ideas..all is very well done,co-op throw steam works great too,no lags,no dc.
Some games can learn from this.
Play time is very solid 25Hours and full price really worth pay.

I play it with my love too and she enjoy it a lot,we both want part 2!!

This game literally had me side splitting laughing. My son an I played thru this story and laughed so hard couldn't stand it! The graphics are so great an the play is fun. I love the puzzle aspect. I expected a short game but it took a bit to get through AND we still haven't done all the minigames or achievements. We can't wait to get back into it.

This game is soooo amazing! It's smooooooth while having amazing graphics! It's like 20 hours of top notch and diverse cooperative play! Oh, and 25 mini-games to find on your story driven adventure! Passion was put into every part of this experience!

This gotta be one of the best games for couples of all time. Me and my girl had a lot of fun while playing this game. It's so fun, especially the references to other games (Super Mario Bros).

This game is a MUST.

Beyond expectations! 
A magical journey full of wonder, surprises, and joy. 

A must-play with your partner.

This is what a game should be, FUN, not overly intense
Fantastic game! Great story, easy mechanics, very cinematic.

Both of us are speechless just on the story alone. The cinematics of this game beat most movies that you can see. Doesn't matter if your SO is bad at playing this game, yet it all becomes worth it when you experience it all together with one person. 

Stop reading this and buy this game now. 

10/10

It's a really fun game to play with a friend or partner! As much as I was scared of the spider bit, I was lucky enough to have my partner finish it for me lol. I would really recommend it especially since only one person needs to own the game if your playing online! Lots of fun memories with this game and lots of COLLABORATION XD. 10/10 would recommend! Dr. Hakim they could never make me hate you.
great fun game with a partner or friends look forward to teh new game from teh company
It was amazing!! Accept for the frogs. (Extreme fear of frogs).

Never have I wanted to slowly torture a book, tearing it apart page-by-page while its little Gen A kindle babies watch in horror - more than I ever have after playing this game... I didn't get this satisfaction unfortunately.

The game is fun though! Not difficult but requires a bit of co-ordination from both people. It also felt ridiculously long and you never really know when the game is going to end, until it kind-of just ends abruptly. For a game that had multiple boss fights along the way, I was surprised there wasn't really a proper one at the end. Like I say... I know who would've been the perfect boss for some closure...

Based on the achievements most people just rush through the game. I highly recommend exploring everything it has to offer as it has some cool/funny/cute hidden gems.
Buggy and with slighty worse connection on some parts not even playable. Worth the 8 euro´s in the sale, absolutely insane for the actual 40 they asking

This  game was awesome. I played with my son, it was really fun. Lots of logic during the game, and nice stoy.  Long enough to enjoy it. You have different skills for each level. I highly recommend this game.

It Takes Two is an amazing co-op game that constantly keeps things fresh. The puzzles, platforming, and combat are all designed for teamwork, and it’s a blast to play with a partner. The story is surprisingly emotional, with great humor and heart. The game looks beautiful, with creative levels that always feel new. If you’ve got a friend to play with, it’s a must-try. Highly recommend!

It's a perfect coop game and nicely fills a gap in the market. It's easy enough for non-gamers but still interesting. The visuals are amazing, the game plays smooth with no issues, the story is cute. This is a full game unlike many coop games which otherwise just feels like a party game.

Its awesome for couples, especially long distance. Me and my girl had this issue where we started to disconnect due to difference in hobbies and a lack of physical connection. We played It Takes Two and in the process genuinly found our connection again.

I genuinely don't understand how people can write off what happens in this game like it's okay.

The amount of disgust I feel that the only way to progress in this game is by torturing and murdering your daughters favorite toy, which mind you, is portrayed as a living creature, is horrific. They make you go through all of the motions of ripping its leg and ear off, dragging it to the edge of a cliff, and forcing its hands off the edge. All of that while you listen to her plead for her life and sob.

The fact that people say this game saved their relationship is insane to me. I get that it's just a game but you guys are psychopaths for that. 

I wanted a cozy game to play with my boyfriend that we could enjoy together, don't know what we got but it sure as shit wasn't cozy.
Amazing story. Great Game play. I highly recommend this game to anyone
It's an insanely great game! I loved it and recommend playing it with as a couple. Make sure you choose the guy, and she chooses the girl. My first review on steam in 15 years.

Genuinely cannot sing the praises of this game enough. Every aspect of it so far is nothing short of genuinely impressive work and love. With a partner, friend or alone you'll enjoy this experience no matter what circumstance you play it.
This is a great game for couples. I played it with my girlfriend and had a blast. Except for the segment with spiders (arachnophobia)
love the game played with the gf now when u get to the boat part u will want to kill ur partner if they cant drive the boat lol

Good long emotional story. It's going to take a while to complete so you will have something to do when you're bored. Sometimes it might feel like it's dragging on, but it's definitely worth it. Many many bosses to fight during the game and keep entertained. I wasn't expecting it to be so good, and since I got it on sale and my teammate got the free friend pass, as an 8 dollar purchase, it was one of the best story oriented games I've ever played, with so many different types of fights and puzzles to complete, you unlock cool abilities to use throughout the game. 10/10 experience.
One of the best two player co-ops I've played. Great story, although a little short.

It Takes Two is a brilliantly designed co-op adventure that delivers nonstop creativity and fun. Every level introduces fresh mechanics that keep the gameplay exciting, while the heartfelt story adds emotional depth. The game’s stunning visuals, engaging puzzles, and charming characters make it an unforgettable experience. Whether playing with a partner or a friend, It Takes Two is a must-play masterpiece that perfectly captures the magic of teamwork. 🎮✨
9/10 with one point taken due to a few bugs and rough edges. Some of the Absolute best graphics and artwork that I have ever seen in a game.

I HIGHLY recommend this game. The music is amazing, The Art is amazing. Just over all a very well made Co-Op game. This will definitely test your skills in collaborating with your partner on getting through each chapter. 

My Husband and I played this together and enjoyed every moment of it. This is a beautiful piece of work that you can tell a lot of love went into.
Absolutely phenomenal game. Playing this with my boyfriend and we had so much fun! One of the most fun, sad, and touching games i have ever played. Highly recommend to try this game out.
really been enjoying this game just be aware there is one part that could cause epilepsy moment

One of the best coop experiences I ever had, I recommend to play it with your partner to have a deeper experience, but even with friends it's incredibly fun!
There is a lot of gameplay variety and a ton of minigames, even if you or the other player are not experienced gamers the fun it's still there and it's not frustrating. 

Definitively a must play!

[b]It Takes Two – First Impressions (4 Hours In)[/b]

I’ve only played It Takes Two for about four hours so far, but I’m already loving it! The scenery is absolutely beautiful, and the gameplay feels smooth and engaging. The story is both good and funny, making every moment enjoyable.

One of the best parts of the game is how much cooperation it requires—you really have to work well with your co-op partner, whether it’s a friend or a family member. There are also fun side activities, like mini-games where you compete against each other. For example, one challenge has you both trying to stay on a mechanical bull as long as possible by pressing the right button at the right time.

The game supports both online and local play, working with either two controllers or a mix of controller and keyboard/mouse. If you enjoy cooperative games with creative mechanics and a charming story, this one is definitely worth checking out!

I rarely feel like this while playing games, but this is what gaming used to feel like when I was little. This is a CO-OP masterpiece, the best I have ever played.

I never played a game where the creativness of the game is shocked me. But this time, I was shocked all along. The maps, the gameplay everything was out of this world. Every map had different mechanics, and the game played into the CO-OP part really hard.

The characters were awesome, Cody and May had deep issues with not only each other but with themselves which made this journey so relatable. The story was heartwarming(except the fucking elephant part), and I was really invested in the relationship of the main couple.

Absolute banger game, I played it with a friend, but I will play it with my future partner because this game must be experienced with a loved one at least once.
You game and your spouse doesnt? You want your spouse to play a story driven game? puzzles? Pick this game up.

This is one of if not the best Co-op game that I have ever played in my life. It has a very strong storyline which makes the game not boring at all. With multiple themes in the game, you will be able to enjoy all kinds of gameplay as each theme requires different type of mechanism to clear the game. I highly recommend playing with a controller as well. My girlfriend bought a controller for me halfway through the game for me to try out as she was saying it really feels different and more enjoyable with it! I really should have listened to her and picked up the game with the controller right from the start. I would probably return and restart the entire game with the controller in the near future
Such a cute little fun game to play with your partner to learn more about eachother and solve puzzles together 💕
The game was great with your significant other or maybe a friend. But I'm still mad about the elephant.

Me and my girlfriend loved everything about this game, but she didn't like the Dr. Hakim's BUTTCHIN. Other than that it was AMAZING to play and great bonding time between us as well! I recomend for friends, lovers, and family, amazing bonding time great game very fun and just so amazing. 10/10

Completely in love with this masterpiece of a game! We are not at the end of the adventure yet, but I'm loving every instant I get to spend in this game. The gameplay is beyond brilliant, extremely varied and so so so fun! The narrative is beautiful too. Definitely a great game to play with your partner, or just anyone you share a great bond with really. A must play for sure!

Amazing game. The story is simple but it's the perfect game to play with your SO.

Plenty of minigames, level design is OUTSTANDING, gameplay is varied with tons of references too. 100% recommended.
The best co-op game hands down. Great gameplay, great visuals, decent story.

The game is really amazing to play with a friend. i enjoyed each and every level. The main disappointment is at last we expected a boss battle but its not there except that the game is amazing with good story and really good level design
Very great game for couples and friends alike! There are so many different scenes throughout the game and I am counting down the days for their new game coming in March!!

Such a good game, with beautiful and diverse cinematics. Various types of game-styles and a mind-gripping storyline. Would 100% recommend for couples looking to enjoy a game together. 10/10 My favorite game.

highly recommended. i hope that many co-op games take inspiration that this game had by only needing 1 person to own it for both to play. I played this game with a friend and by the end of it i really like how we bonded just but either absorbing the story, the satisfying platforming that we would mess up over and over again, or even just laughing at the little mechanics in the different areas like the amount of time we spent just throwing snow balls. overall a very fun well thought game and i cant wait to play their next title.

The game isn’t just about solving puzzles; it’s about sharing an experience and learning about each other, both in-game and in real life. If you have someone to play with, It Takes Two is an absolute must-play. It’s a beautiful, innovative, and emotional journey that showcases the best of what cooperative gaming can offer.

Super fun.  Great for couples needing to connect over a fun collaborative experience.  The story is fun for adults, but great for kids too, even though it's a husband + wife couple--would be a little weird if you're a parent playing with a kid, but there's little intimacy, so, not that weird I guess; just talk about it first.  The multiplayer works great if you have two controllers.
This is an amazing game to play with a partner. Me and my partner decided to play this and it was one the most enjoyable this we have done together. It is a great game and it deserved to win goty.

C'est une masterclass, il faut absolument y jouer avec ta copine si tu en as l'occasion. Je vous le recommande, l'histoire est incroyable et très émouvante, elle est vraiment bien recherchée. On ne s'ennuie jamais, le jeu arrive toujours à s'innover avec de nouvelles mécaniques à chaque niveau. En plus, on change complètement de décor en fonction des niveaux, avec une qualité graphique assez exceptionnelle. Bref, il faut absolument y jouer.
Really nice relaxing co-op. Cute story, fun puzzles and bosses.
very fun game to play with your significant other.
Another Super Fun Co-op game from Hazelight Studios. The design, creativity and gameplay of this title was 10/10. No wonder it won 'Game of the Year' Award. Highly Recommended
A fantastic game. I can see why it won awards. Me and my girlfriend had a ton of fun playing it . It has tons of variety, and interesting premise, and a lot of charm.

One of the absolute best games you could play with someone. It Takes Two is a brilliant cooperative multiplayer experience that offers hours of entertainment through its engaging gameplay and fun mechanics.

While the conclusion is somewhat anticlimactic, it doesn't diminish the overall experience. It is worth experiencing for its creativity and emotional depth. If you haven't played it yet, do yourself a favor and dive in—it's an unforgettable team adventure that will leave you wanting more.

One of the best co-op games I've ever played. Amazing story and fun puzzles we had a blast playing this and highly recommend if you have someone to play it with.

The cutie part was hard. If you know you know.

A game that I feel obligated to comment on, just because it's SO GOOD. 

I felt all the feels playing this.. the story is both heartbreaking and heartwarming. The collaborative gameplay and humour made me laugh 'til I cried. 

There are some nods to other games to look out for, but you absolutely don't have to be a gamer to play this. It's a very straight forward game with the right balance of varying difficulty puzzles. 
There are also a bunch of optional minigames scattered around (good luck if you or your partner are highly competitive).

I'd also point out that you can absolutely play this with a friend. You don't have to be in a relationship to appreciate the story.

The graphics are great - the amount of detail is incredible and I love how much you can interact with the different environments. It's definitely worth taking the time to look around, rather than just blazing through objectives.

I was pleasantly surprised by how long the game was. I expected it to be a good few hours shorter.

I frequently see this game on sale, and I got it for £7. That's an absolute STEAL. 
This game is worth every penny at its full price and I highly recommend it.
10/10 worthy of all its awards and I will absolutely play again.

i dont know how to put into words how amazing this game really is. i have no problems or issues with this game. it was completely and utterly perfect in every single way.
the story? compelling and exciting
the characters? lovable with entertaining dialogue
the gameplay? simple yet extremely effective and engaging
the graphics? visually stunning and honestly beautiful
i would be lying if i didnt say this wasnt one of my all time favourite games, every aspect was perfect
this game made me a better person
Creative and simple puzzles makes it playable with someone who is not experienced in video games.
This is one of the most beautiful games I've ever played. I had a great time playing it with my friend. Definitely recommended to everyone.

One of the most incredible games I've ever played! This game has passed beyond my expectations for a game. I can't recommend it enough. The graphics are stunning, beautifully designed and the attention to detail is out of this world. Such a well designed & fun game. The mechanics, puzzles, gameplay, the music, the art... everything was perfect. All the levels were completely different and challenging. You can never guess what is about to come. The amount of effort and imagination went into the making of the game was on a whole other level.
I was playing with my partner and we both had a blast. We enjoyed every second playing, got emotional, excited and competitive throughout the whole game. Our favorite part of the whole game was the mini games and the bug spa! We had so much fun exploring the places on each level. When we had just finished the game, it felt like an absolutely beautiful dream. Easily one of the best co-op experiences my partner and I have ever had.
Fantastic story, great puzzles, immersive art style.  This was an awesome way to spend 10 hours with a buddy.
lovely, not too hard, very creative in combining genres and features

This game is now one off all of my all-time favorites. It always surprises you with new mechanics, environments and soundtracks. I can really recommend it to everyone because only one of the two players actually has to own the game, which I find extremely nice.

really fun playing, great animations and graphics and the story it self is really nice, was way harder playing with controllers than on pc, some parts are really creative and awesome with not too much talking which is a big advantage for me.
The design, the idea, the content, is so unpredictable and fun to play

Master Piece, the movement is smothe the lvls are hard enouth, but dont feel frustrating throu the respawn mechanics and checkpoint. The movement feels dynamic and engaging. 

Love It 
<3

Pure perfection. Great characters. Great lore. Great storytelling. Great character design. Great Map designs. Great puzzles. Great mini games. Great Environment. Great enemies. Great voice actors. Great atmosphere. Great Soundtracks. Great cut scenes. Great job at everything such a fun and amazing gameplay that I wished it'd never end.

This is one of the best games I've played in a long time. 

I've heard a lot about this game over the past few years, but never really cared to look into it, up until a friend mentioned that I could play the game for free without buying it because this game has a feature to allow you to install it and play it joining a friend who owns the game. Yes, seriously. I also couldn't believe it myself.

I was so impressed with this game, I bought it on sale, despite the fact that I could have played it start to finish for free.

Without going into any details, I will say this game has a bit of a dark story and it is a rollercoaster.

The amount of detail, love and care that's gone into this game really shows, it's optimised well and I don't have any complaints. It even has MSAA x4 anti-aliasing! No DLSS fake frame upscaling nonsense, no ray tracing, and yet this is one of the most detailed games I have ever seen. I wish every game had the level of polish, love and detail of this.

Well done Hazelight Studios, this is an absolute classic.

this game takes you through such an amazing experience that it makes every other game feel boring 



p.s only play this with someone you want to trauma bond with

All I got to say is wow. This was a great game with lots of little hidden mini games. I played through it with my son, and had a great time doing so.. I wish they would make another one of these gems. I would definitely recommend.
playing with a friend, this game has a great story, beautiful graphics and the fun I am having playing I must say, it was worthed the $8.00 I paid for it. yay
Very good game design, with different elements in many aspects. And the combination of humor and story makes it very worthwhile to play.

It Takes Two is one of those rare games that feels truly special. The story about Cody and May, a couple trying to save their marriage, is heartwarming and relatable, with real emotional depth. The game design is pure brilliance! Each level introduces unique mechanics that require you to work together in fun, creative ways. The world is beautifully crafted, full of charm and wonder, making every moment feel fresh and exciting. But what stands out the most is the powerful message about teamwork, communication, and the importance of working through challenges together. It’s a heartfelt adventure that’s as meaningful as it is fun. Loved it!
this game is soo cool it can fix relaionships and the gameplay is soo cool i recommend this game for any couple or friends

The main protagonists start to get their shit together after essentially committing a war crime.
10/10 would recommend.

I have not played through the whole game yet, but so far It Takes Two has a cute story with interesting characters. It feels a lot like an older Pixar movie. Back when they were still good. The game has fun puzzles and environments to get through but they aren't so hard as to hold you up in getting through the story (not so far, at least). The game throws in new temporary mechanics and weapons to keep changing things up and changing up the puzzles too, which helps keep things fresh through the game.

Even though this is a game dealing with a divorce, so far the writing and voice acting hasn't felt so heavy as to affect the up beat nature of the game. And the love book character actually gives you relationship advice, throughout the game, that is good and simple advice.

If you have a friend to play through this with, please consider trying it. And if you have a partner who can play games, this is SUCH a great date night game! I HIGHLY reccomend for that!
very worth it to play with friends or family, highly recommended
very pleasant game with great changes of enviroment and nice puzzles
knew it was a fun and well-made product but didn't expect such STUNNING visuals :) loved the wasp hive exp i just have to own this game!

I ended up making mad love with my homie after this. 
10/10 the 10 hours of gameplay recorded felt longer.
highly recommended for couples and really good friends

Great game. It has good art style and graphics. It has nice gameplay too. Although there are some levels that feels tedious and lacking. Also experienced crashes on some levels. Overall Nice game to play with others.

Fun friendly game for a couple of friends who want to have a laugh and cooperate through the harshness of the game. The embedded mini games were fun for the most part and how the game-play had elements from other famous classics such as rainbow road is a fun blast from the past.
